intro: Triodia repens, commonly known as spear grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and坚韧, adapted to survive in arid and semi-arid environments. Triodia repens plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various desert fauna.
